titles:
Pi hook: auto-title sessions from commit messages

- Hook detects git commit commands via tool_result event
- Extracts commit message from -m flag
- Saves as session title to .resume-sessions/sessions.json
- Updates terminal tab title via ANSI escape

Simplified from earlier prompting approach which had timing issues.

Add resume command to display Pi sessions with titles

- find_pi_sessions() discovers sessions in ~/.pi/agent/sessions/
- project_name_to_path() converts encoded dir names back to paths
- resume command shows sessions with dates, projects, and titles
- Smart path resolution handles hyphens in directory names

Enhanced resume display: relative time, first message, multi-line format

- Add format_relative_time() for human-readable timestamps (

Add interactive session selector with search and --run option

- Add rich dependency for TUI rendering
- Add fuzzy_filter_sessions() for searching by project/message/title
- Add build_session_choices() to prepare display data
- Add run_interactive_selector() with keyboard navigation:
  - ↑↓ to navigate, Enter to select, / to search, q to quit
- Add --interactive/-i flag for TUI mode
- Add --run flag to execute pi --resume with selected session
- 40 tests passing
Update docs: README with new CLI usage, progress log for session 3
Fix hook to use first line of commit message only

Implement Claude Code hook for session titles

- Add install_claude_code_hook() that:
  - Creates ~/.claude/hooks/resume-sessions-hook.py
  - Updates ~/.claude/settings.json with PostToolUse hook
- Hook extracts commit message from git commit commands
- Uses first line only (same as Pi hook)
- 42 tests passing
Update docs: Claude Code now supported, all features complete
Truncate long titles in interactive selector
Redesign interactive selector: first message prominent, title as bonus
Align non-interactive format with interactive: first message prominent
Revert to spec: title on line 1, first message as context
Fix interactive selector: scrolling and search mode
